question:
An English-speaking friend has written to you to ask you how your English studies are going.  Write a letter telling your friend about your progress. In your lettersay what progress you are making
describe the study methods and any materials you are usingsay what you find most difficult
text: I hope you are in the pink of your health.It's been a long since we have had the time to catch up and reminisce about things.Let's meet anytime soon,if possible.Anyways,I am writing this missive in response to your letter.On a day-to-day ,basis a drastic change has been observed in my vocabulary by my friends.Besides, in the listening and reading task,I am able to score about 30 marks in the weekly mock test while in the other two modules,I am able to score satisfactory results.

I have purchased the Cambridge books from 1-12 for all the modules.Apart from it,I am taking the Speaking and Writing classes from my friend who had given the IELTS.Moreover,I am watching some youtube videos that are very efficient for practice.
Although,I'm able to cope with all the sections yet writing section require quiet practice that I am not able to manage because of my hectic schedule.
Give my regards to my uncle and aunt.
